==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|つち|け|yomi=y}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=つちけ|土|tr1=tsuchi|t1=earth, soil|気|tr2=ke|t2=quality, sense}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=y|つちけ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|つちけ|kyu=土氣}}

# [[earthy|Earthy]] qualities, such as the moisture and smell of soil.
#: {{ja-usex|この畑は、'''土気'''が良い。|^この はたけ は、 '''つちけ''' が よい。|This field has good soil {{qualifier|such as for planting}}.}}

===Adjectival noun===
{{ja-adj|infl=na|つちけ|kyu=土氣}}

# [[rural|Rural]] or [[countrified]] in [[thought]] or [[manner]]: [[hickish]], [[uncultured]].

====Inflection====
{{ja-na|つちけ}}
